forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4am, then showers and thunderstorms. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 53. South southeast wind 17 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 51 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, an afternoon soaked in rain prepares to deepen into a night thick with shadows and storms. The air is heavy, almost electric, as clouds loom over the skyline, cloaking the city in a grayish shroud and whispering secrets of impending downpours. A brisk wind from the south southeast tussles with the chill, urging the temperatures to drop further into the evening. The likelihood of rain hangs palpably in the air, predicting a transformation of the landscape into a tempestuous theater where thunder may roll and heavy raindrops perform their rhythmic dance upon rooftops and sidewalks.

As darkness descends, the clouds will thicken and deepen, revealing a night enveloped in sheets of rain and potential thunderclaps. Beneath such relentless skies, one might find comfort in seeking refuge within the warm embrace of a cozy café, where a steaming mug of hot chocolate or spiced chai becomes a companion to the symphony of raindrops outside. For those who must venture out, layers become essential; a sturdy raincoat, accompanied by solid boots, will withstand the weather’s theatrics. Yet in this atmospheric embrace, there dwells a unique allure—a chance to witness the city’s fleeting quietude, glistening in the rain, where each glimmering streetlight reflects the ebb and flow of the urban tide.
